page.title: 15Basing House- Nowadays
page.content: Basing House today is the{ruin}of a once{Norman,}once{Tudor Manor.}It was {destroyed }in the{Civil war. The Garrison Gate is a 16th Century gateway, entrance to the ruins, displaying the Paulet{coat-of-arms. The old House is the remains of a {Tudor Manor}built on an old{medieval {castle. The new house (Tudor) was built after the first manor on a larger scale. The{Dovecotes}are{towers}on the {garden walls,}which can keep 500 {doves,}the best in England today. There are 4 main{wells}in the grounds the largest being the{'Roman Well', although it is not really Roman.It is 50 feet deep and 11 feet in diameter. People also come from miles around to see 4 rare plants;{Wall Bedstraw, {Pellitory-of-the-wall,Wall Rue}and the {Fine-Leaved Sandwart.
